original: Key, Carl Lennart Johan, kommendörkapten i marinen, Norrköping, f. 6/8/98 i Karlskrona av öv:löjtn. i marinen C. L. Key o. Märta Scharp. G. 27 m. Louise Nordenadier. Barn: Arthür f. 28, Gerd 31. — Stud :ex. v. Lundsberg 16, sjÖ0’ff:ex. 19, KSHS, första årets kurs, 25, KSHS, tekn. forts :kurs i förbind :teknik, 32. Fartygschef å torpedbåtar, minsv. o. kryssare, sammani. tretton fartyg, 22-37, medföljde pansarkryss. Fylgia å dess långresa 28-29, lär. i eng. v. Sthlms örlogsstations radiosk. samt i ehteknik (res :kadetter) o. förbind :lära (stam-kadetter) v. KSS 32-36, lär. i off:kur-ser v. radiostat. 36-43, under andra värld skr. kommend. å det nya fÖT-bind:fart. som chef f. kustflottans bas-radiostat. o. basförbind :väs. samt radioskolor, mil :assist. v. telegrafv. m. plac. i Norrköp. sed. 44. Handh. div. utredn. ang. flottans förbind :väs., bl. a. ovannämnda förbind :fartyg. Styr :-led. i Sv:es Flottas lokalavd. i Norrköp., dito i Telegrafv. i Norrköp. TF sed. 45, ordf. i föräldrafören. v. Norrköp. h. a. 1. sed. s. å. Hållit föredrag o. föreläsn. i bl. a. ämn. Atomåldern, Marinens insats i krig o. fred, Sjötaktik. Skr.: art. i sjömil, o. hemv:-spörsmål i tidn. o. tidskr. Hobbies: färgfilmn. m. smalfilm, atomåldern. Rsb, RBLeopn:sO, RDDO, Sv. idr:-förb. idr:Gm. Key-Åberg, Hans Malcolm Ludvig, med. dr fältläkare, chefläkare, författare, Linköping, f. 16/6/86 i Sthlm av prof., med. dr Algot K.-A. o. Ellen Aman. G. 1. 15-24 m. Dagmar Behm; 2. 40 m. Inga Norrbin. Barn: Ingrid f. 16. — Mog:ex. 04, med. kand. 08 o. med. lic. 14, allt i Sthlm, med. dr i Lund 34. Utr. stud :res. 20, 28, 36, 47. Und :läk. v. Västerås las. 14-15, aman. v. Seraf :las. öron-, näs- o. halspoü-klin. 15-16, v. Sabbatsb. sjukh. otiatr. klin. 18-20, sjukh :läk. v. Garn :sjukh. i Linköp. öronavd. sed. 23, chefläk. där sed. 39. E. bat:läk. v. Svea livg. 20, v. Andra livgren :reg. 24, v. Livgren :reg. 27, reg:läk. i Fik 25 o. v. Livgren :reg. 40, fältläk. i Fik 42. Läk. v. Sv. Röda korsets ambul. i Belgrad 12 o. v. Reservespital XV i Wien 17 samt chef f. 35. finska krigssjukh. öron-, näs- o. halsavd. 41. Äg. Åbonäs säteri m. und :lyd. i Säby s :n, Jönköp. 1., samt Söderbo jämte delar av Lådna skärg. i Värmdö s :n, Sthhns 1. Medl. av Sv.es förf :fören. Utg. ett 50-tal skr. inom oto-rhino-laryngolog., diktsaml., reseskildr. samt släkt- o. personhist. arb. (Släkten fr. gårdarna, Verner v. Heidenstam, Carl Xll:s vådaskott) m. m. RXO, RVO, KFinl-VRO, FFrKZkl, OffSerbS :tSO, RRS:t-A02kl, UngJubO, TM03kl, FMM, FM pro ben. humana, SerbMM, Sv-R K S M, Serb R KHt, Ty skR KHt2kl, URKHk, ÖRKOffHt.
translated: Key, Carl Lennart Johan, Commander Captain in the Navy, Norrköping, born 6/8/98 in Karlskrona, son of Lieutenant in the Navy C. L. Key and Märta Scharp. Married 27 to Louise Nordenadier. Children: Arthür born in 28, Gerd in 31. Completed examination at Lundsberg in 1916, Naval Officer examination in 1919, KSHS, first year's course in 1925, KSHS, technical advanced course in communication technology in 1932. Served as ship commander on torpedo boats, mine sweepers, and cruisers, commanding thirteen ships from 1922-1937, accompanied the armored cruiser Fylgia on its long journey in 1928-1929, taught English at Stockholm Naval Station's radio school and telecommunications technology (reserve cadets) and communication theory (officer cadets) at KSS from 1932-1936, taught officer courses at the radio station from 1936-1943, during World War II wrote a command on the new Communication Vessel as head of the Coastal Fleet's base radio station and base communication facilities, as well as radio schools, served as a military assistant at the Telegraph Administration with a placement in Norrköping since 1944. Handled various investigations regarding the navy's communication facilities, including the aforementioned communication vessels. Board member of Sweden's Fleet Local Department in Norrköping, as well as the Telegraph Administration in Norrköping since 1945, chairman of the parent association in Norrköping's h. a. 1. since the same year. Has given lectures on subjects such as the Atomic Age, the Navy's involvement in war and peace, and Naval tactics. Written articles on naval miles and home defense in newspapers and magazines. Hobbies include color film with small film, and the Atomic Age. Member of the Royal Society of Sciences in Uppsala, Royal Swedish Society of Naval Sciences, Royal Swedish Academy of War Sciences, Knight of the Order of the Polar Star, Knight of the Order of the Sword, Silver Medal for Athletic Achievements from the Swedish Sports Confederation. Married to Åberg, Hans Malcolm Ludvig, Medical Doctor Field Doctor, Chief Physician, Author, Linköping, born 16/6/86 in Stockholm, son of Professor, Medical Doctor Algot K.-A. and Ellen Aman. Married 1. in 1915-1924 to Dagmar Behm, 2. in 1940 to Inga Norrbin. Child: Ingrid born in 1916. Completed a medical degree in 1904, Candidate of Medicine in 1908, and Medical Licentiate in 1914, all in Stockholm, received a Doctor of Medicine degree in Lund in 1934. Studied abroad in 1920, 1928, 1936, and 1947. Worked as an assistant doctor at Västerås Hospital from 1914-1915, assistant at Serafimerlasarettet Ear, Nose, and Throat Clinic from 1915-1916, at Sabbatsberg Hospital's Otiatric Clinic from 1918-1920, as a hospital physician at Garnison Hospital in Linköping's Ear Department since 1923, and has been the chief physician there since 1939. Served as a battalion physician for Svea Life Guards in 1920, for the Second Life Grenadiers Regiment in 1924, for the Life Grenadiers Regiment in 1927, regimental physician in Fik 1925 and in the Life Grenadiers Regiment in 1940, field doctor in Fik 1942. Served as a physician at the Swedish Red Cross ambulance in Belgrade in 1912 and at Reserve Hospital XV in Vienna in 1917, as well as being the head of the Finnish War Hospital's Ear, Nose, and Throat Department with 35 staff in 1941. Owns Åbonäs Estate with dependent properties in Säby parish, Jönköping, and Söderbo and parts of Lådna archipelago in Värmdö parish, Stockholm county. Member of the Swedish Writers' Association. Published around 50 works in the field of otorhinolaryngology, poetry collections, travel accounts, as well as genealogical and personal historical work (Family from the Farms, Verner von Heidenstam, Charles XII's misfortune) and more. Commander of the Order of Vasa, Knight of the Order of the Polar Star, Knight of the Order of the White Rose of Finland, Knight of the French Legion of Honor, Officer of the Serbian Order of St. Sava, Rice Medal 1903 class, Order of the Cross of Merit, Field Marshal Model of Germany, Serbian Silver Cross of Merit, Serbian Royal Order of the Cross, Knight of the Royal Order of the Seraphim, and Officer of the Order of the North Star.
